com.github.davidcarboni.cryptolite

Class DigitalSignature

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.davidcarboni.cryptolite.DigitalSignature

  • public class DigitalSignature
extends Object
    This class provides a public-private key digital signature capability. The signature algorithm used is "SHA256withRSAandMGF1".
    Author:
    David Carboni

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String ALGORITHM
      The digital signature algorithm to use: "SHA256withRSAandMGF1".

    • Constructor Summary

      The default constructor initialises the instance with the "SHA256withRSAandMGF1" algorithm.

      This constructor is protected so that, should you need a different algorithm (e.g.

    • Field Detail

      • ALGORITHM

        public static final String ALGORITHM
        The digital signature algorithm to use: "SHA256withRSAandMGF1".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • DigitalSignature

        public DigitalSignature()
        The default constructor initialises the instance with the "SHA256withRSAandMGF1" algorithm.

      • DigitalSignature

        protected DigitalSignature(String algorithm)
        This constructor is protected so that, should you need a different algorithm (e.g. if you're integrating with a system that uses different crypto settings) it is possible to create a subclass with different settings.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - This should normally be "SHA256withRSAandMGF1".

    • Method Detail

      • sign

        public String sign(String content,
                   PrivateKey privateKey)
        Generates a digital signature for the given string.
        Parameters:
        content - The string to be digitally signed.
        privateKey - The PrivateKey with which the string is to be signed. This can be obtained via Keys.newKeyPair().
        Returns:
        The signature as a base64-encoded string. If the content is null, null is returned.

      • sign

        public String sign(InputStream content,
                   PrivateKey privateKey)
        Generates a digital signature for the given InputStream.
        Parameters:
        content - The input to be digitally signed.
        privateKey - The PrivateKey with which the input is to be signed. This can be obtained via Keys.newKeyPair().
        Returns:
        The signature as a base64-encoded string. If the content is null, null is returned.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(String content,
                      PublicKey publicKey,
                      String signature)
        Verifies whether the given content matches the given signature.
        Parameters:
        content - The content to be verified.
        publicKey - The public key to use in the verification process.
        signature - The signature with which the content is to be verified. This can be obtained via Keys.newKeyPair().
        Returns:
        If the content matches the given signature, using the given key, true.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(InputStream input,
                      PublicKey publicKey,
                      String signature)
        Parameters:
        input - The content for which the signature is to be verified.
        publicKey - The PublicKey corresponding to the PrivateKey that was used to sign the content. This can be obtained via Keys.newKeyPair().
        signature - The signature to be verified.
        Returns:
        If the signature matches the input and key, true. Otherwise false.

      • getSignature

        protected Signature getSignature()
        Returns:
        A new Signature instance.
